etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French porc espin, from Provençal porc espi(n), from Latin porcus ‘pig’ + spina ‘thorn’

definitions: a large rodent with defensive spines or quills on the body and tail.

notes.text: Suborder Hystricomorpha: families Hystricidae (three Old World genera) and Erethizontidae (four New World genera). The common North American species is Erethizon dorsatum

shortDefinitions: large rodent with defensive spines or quills
